newsitem.title: UK: NWE jet spreads stable, trade inactive.
newsitem.headline: NWE jet spreads stable, trade inactive.

text.p: NWE jet differentials were steady in quiet business on Wednesday, traders said.
August IPE gas oil futures last traded up +$3.25 a tonne at $171 on bullish U.S. inventory data.
Barges were assessed unchanged around $18 to $19 over August IPE. Buyers are holding off, arguing the spreads are excessively expensive and they can afford to wait for numbers to head south.
Cargoes are languishing notionally around $15 to $16 over August but a 10-day-old standoff between buyers and sellers has eroded any consensus on fair value on the cif market.
